comment.author: 44911068@N03
comment._content: Looks lika a Manta Ray ???  Didn't know that Ray's swam as far north as Ireland !!!

comment.author: 11147304@N02
comment._content: Wonder if the location of Ahascragh is correct as it's a fair distance to the sea?

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/11147304@N02] Absolutely take your point about distance, but our Clonbrock Collection photos were taken in and around Clonbrock Estate at Ahascragh by members of the Dillon family...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 11147304@N02
comment._content: I could be wrong but that looks like seaweed at the base of the wall which would indicate that it was taken when the tide was out. Perhaps it was taken during a day out at the seaside. Very sheltered harbour as the stone wall would not have taken heavy waves too well.Looks like the two men are about to go to work on it with their knives.It's a wonderful collection of photos and thanks for displaying them. Pity the old house was destroyed by fire in 1902. You must have the finest family album around for those times.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/11147304@N02] From the looks of that wall, it's more likely to be a tidal estuary - so perhaps a bit inland but still tidal? Trying to meet you in the middle here - somewhere between the coast and Ahascragh...  :)

More than welcome on the displaying/sharing of the photos - it's gives us great pleasure, and helps so much in what we know about them.
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 75556178@N05
comment._content: The Dillon family had relations at Kilcornan house on the South Eastern shore of Galway bay. I suspect that this photo was taken somewhere near the world famous village of Clarinbridge. I notice that Kilcornan house itself features in the Dillon Clonbrock collection. Kilcornan house was once owned by a branch of the Dillon dynasty. Today it belongs to the Brothers of Charity.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/75556178@N05] Thank you very much! I suspect your suspicion about Kilcornan House could be spot on...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons
